channel.title: Dung keys
channel.description: you have to use keys for my dung skill to get to the next floor but i can't seem to find the keys id I was wondering if anyone would know the ID

item.title: Dung keys
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

starbeast199:

ive searched everywhere in my server for the word key but i still couldn’t find the code

You said:

[quote=“starbeast199, post:8, topic:551858”]I’ve just downloaded a source and i think the monster were suppose to drop the keys bc i can’t find the keys anywhere on the floor and I’ve been looking for “keys” and “dung” and all of my files and haven’t found key id
I’ve only seen where it says use 4 keys on pillars[/quote]
What was the code near that message?

Read full topic

item.title: Dung keys
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“starbeast199, post:8, topic:551858”]I’ve just downloaded a source and i think the monster were suppose to drop the keys bc i can’t find the keys anywhere on the floor and I’ve been looking for “keys” and “dung” and all of my files and haven’t found key id
I’ve only seen where it says use 4 keys on pillars[/quote]
Trace the code…

look for the message you get when trying to open a door or whatever. That should give you the IDs of the 4 keys…
Then you search for the ids of the keys… probably in NPCHandler if anything (Since that handles npc drops).
If you get no results, then that part is probably missing…

Read full topic

item.title: Dung keys
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

starbeast199:

how would i add it into my code where i use them to open doors? to the next floor

Have you read any part of your dungeoneering code? Because if you had wrote it yourself, you’d know how it works.
Read the code and see what “Keys” it’s looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Dung keys
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Then you don’t have those items in your cache, or your server’s not loading that high (or perhaps, allowing you to spawn), or you’re client’s not loading that high.

Read full topic
